page.title: 17Apple Growing In Selborne
page.content: There have been many changes in apple growing and picking over the last forty years.The trees fruit on two year old wood and careful pruning is essential.They start pruning in November and finish in June.Now they have started using a spray which restricts the growth so less pruning is needed.April to May is when the blossoms form.In July the apples Katie Discovery and Grenadier are picked.In September,the Cox,Bramley,Ida Red, Golden Delicious,Spartan and Russets are ready.Apples cover 300 acres.Every apple picking season 100 extra people are hired.Trees used to grow up to 10 metres high.Very big and costly ladders were needed for pickers.Now they don't grow more than 2 metres.The average amount of apples grown each year is about 100,000 bushels.New varieties are always being discovered!
